description.narrative:
261 Management plan published
262 Number of guidance documents published

comment.narrative: No targets for phaseout set yet and guideline documents outdated

261 Development of a PCB management and phaseout plan
262 Development of accompanying guidance documents

Basis set for the revision of the The Guide for PCB Inventory and also the National PCB Management and phaseout Plan delivered in 2011 based on the summary of the information and discussions carried on under the seminar on treatment of PCB held in 21st to 22nd July 2015

description.narrative: 23 Number of facilities acording to the best available technologies and standards for PCB waste treatment in Brazil

comment.narrative: PCB treatment and destruction facilities not meeting international standards
23 PCB treatment and destruction facilities acording to the best available technologies with capacity to meet demand while adhering to national standards

4 plants for decontamination of PCB equipments located at Sao Paulo Paraná and Minas Gerais identified
3 incinerators licensed for processing PCB wastes located at southeast and northeast regions identified

description.narrative: 21 Number of laboratories certified to standards to complete PCB management and enforcement efforts

comment.narrative: Uncertainties on PCB analytical techniques and laboratory certification system not meeting international standards
21 A nationwide qualification system for analysis laboratories and PCB treatment facilities developed

Laboratories supported to be able to be due certified for PCB analysis through a training program about Quality Management Systems for quantitative analysis of PCB applying Brazilian Normatives ABNT NBR 170252005 and ABNT NBR ISO 138862005
21 A nationwide qualification system for analysis laboratories and PCB treatment facilities developed

Laboratories supported to be able to be due certified for PCB analysis through a training program about Quality Management Systems for quantitative analysis of PCB applying Brazilian Normatives ABNT NBR 170252005 and ABNT NBR ISO 138862005

comment.narrative: Uncertainties on results from PCB analytical techniques and laboratory certification system

description.narrative: Outcome 3 Environmentally sound storage and disposal of identified PCB waste by demonstration projects
34 Four 4 demonstration sites executed and technicians from the environmental agencies and PCB owners trained

comment.narrative: Consultations have started with two workshops in 2008
34 Use of several PCB treatment demonstration projects to validate guidelines and standards use for training purposes and for viewing by stakeholders

As mentioned above each one of the four 4 demonstration projects include training programs for the stakeholders and also include closure workshop for discussing the results for the demonstration activities The workshop will also look to the next steps for implementing recommendations for PCB Management and Action Plan aiming compliance of Stockholm Convention deadlines

comment.narrative: No demonstration sites

description.narrative: 32 One fully compliant PCB storage site established by PCB owners for viewing training and verification of standards

comment.narrative: No formal storage sites have been established
32 Testing PCB disposal options environmental suitability and economic viability for both pure and lowcontaminated PCB waste disposal of approx 1000 tonnes of PCB

Implementation of the three 3 demonstrative projects in Power Companies includes preparation of an action plan for deactivation of PCB equipments and subsequent PCB destruction always concerning about environmental and safety standards
Besides The National Coordination is planning to extend the Project deadline for more 2 two years in order to execute specific demonstrative projectc aiming PCB destruction at storage sites

description.narrative: 31 Number of demonstration projects of PCB equipment decommissioning and treatmentdestruction

comment.narrative: No projects meeting international standards have been completed

31 Successfully testing the revised standards and regulations according to international practices
At least three demonstration projects of PCB equipment decommissioning and treatmentdestruction

Demonstration projects are considered of great importance to validate in practice the Guidelines developed by this project and proposed Regulations for the development of the National PCB inventory and the implementation of the PCB Management Plan as well for the remediation of contaminated sites and adequate disposal of PCB wastes

31 Successfully testing the revised standards and regulations according to international practices
At least three demonstration projects of PCB equipment decommissioning and treatmentdestruction

Demonstration projects are considered of great importance to validate in practice the Guidelines developed by this project and proposed Regulations for the development of the National PCB inventory and the implementation of the PCB Management Plan as well for the remediation of contaminated sites and adequate disposal of PCB wastes

description.narrative: Strengthening of legal administrative and standardized procedures framework for the PCB management and disposal
1 1 Number of legislativeregulatory amendments to respond to legislative gap developed

comment.narrative: Brazil has a regulation banning the use of new PCBs However there are major gaps in legislation framework and enforcement policies related to the management and environmentally safe disposal of PCBs
11 A Comprehensive and complete PCB legislation developed and established to ensure PCB management

Draft resolution proposed aiming to establish 3 years deadline for the complete inventory and a gradual elimination schedule on the energy sector and industry holding PCB Beside the regulatory approach demonstration projects will be carried out beyond training and communication activities as well in order to stimulate them to full fill their obligations under Stockholm Convention
11 A Comprehensive and complete PCB legislation developed and established to ensure PCB management

Draft resolution proposed aiming to establish 3 years deadline for the complete inventory and a gradual elimination schedule on the energy sector and industry holding PCB Beside the regulatory approach demonstration projects will be carried out beyond training and communication activities as well in order to stimulate them to full fill their obligations under Stockholm Convention

comment.narrative: Consultations have started with two workshops in 2008
12 All stakeholders from interested sectors fully engaged in supporting PCB management plan

NGOs actively engaged in national debate on treatment options towards the environmentally sound management of PCB
Energy sector analytical labs and industry as well as NGOs and federal government representatives actively engaged in the negotiations under CONAMA on the national regulations on PCB management
Energy companies willingness and engaged in the demonstration projects planning and preparations
12 All stakeholders from interested sectors fully engaged in supporting PCB management plan

comment.narrative: Outdated and incomplete guidance material and standards

description.narrative: The main development objective of the project is to enhance the capacity to manage and dispose of PCB waste in a sustainable manner and by extension to minimize risk of PCB exposure to the population and the environment
1 Number of reviewed and approved standards and rules for PCB management

comment.narrative: 1 Incomplete and fractured legislation guidance and PCB programs
11 Complete actualized and eficient standards guidelines and rules for PCB management

Project Coordination is following up the process of CONAMA Council According its procedures the draft text of the Resolution was amended and approved by the Technical Board The draft Resolution was then submitted to the Legal Board and is now being evaluatedreviewed in order to be submitted to the Plenary voting during its 120th Ordinary Meeting expected to take place in November 2015
11 Complete actualized and eficient standards guidelines and rules for PCB management

Project Coordination is following up the process of CONAMA Council According its procedures the draft text of the Resolution was amended and approved by the Technical Board The draft Resolution was then submitted to the Legal Board and is now being evaluatedreviewed in order to be submitted to the Plenary voting during its 120th Ordinary Meeting expected to take place in November 2015

description.narrative: 2Number of adequate registered and capacitated facilities for PCB decontamination and destruction

comment.narrative: 2 PCB management infrastructure not meeting international standards and without adequate training mechanisms
21 Sustainable infrastructure for PCB management including decontamination and safety disposal in a timely fashion
Inventory Guidelines for PCB Management and Guidelines for PCB Management and PhaseOut were revised and are now available at the Ministry of the Environment website at Chemicals Safety Division link
21 Sustainable infrastructure for PCB management including decontamination and safety disposal in a timely fashion
Inventory Guidelines for PCB Management and Guidelines for PCB Management and PhaseOut were revised and are now available at the Ministry of the Environment website at Chemicals Safety Division link

description.narrative:
31Number of PCBs management regulations developed and approaches tested
32 Number of demonstration projects completed
33 Number of inventoried PCB equipments

comment.narrative: No PCB management demonstration projects complying with international standards completed

31 Guidelines and rules for PCB management tested at the demonstration projects
32 Four demonstration projects executed at Energy Utilities and PCB contaminated sites
33 At least three demonstration projects for inventoring PCB equipments concluded

For the first demonstration Project a consultancy was contracted to hiring implementing evaluation of a potential contaminated site in Curitiba Parana in South Region of Brazil
Procurement to hire a company to carry undertake the 3 demonstration projects on inventories destruction of PCBs finalized based in Manaus Amazonas and Recife Pernambuco and Curitiba Parana
Activities should be developed from August 2015 to April 2016
